title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 April 2009 - XWiki

sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 07:17): news

sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 07:20): And partner for Concerto

ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/04/2009 11:47): Hai:sdumitriu  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 11:47): Hi  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/04/2009 11:48): I'm getting a exception when I trying to delete the 14Mb file that I uploaded to the wiki  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/04/2009 11:48): http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/ChathuraPrabuddha#Attachments  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/04/2009 11:49): it happens when deleting the 14Mb file  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/04/2009 11:49): anyway the system didn't stop me when I uploading the 14Mb file  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 11:49): Yes, it's a memory problem  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 11:50): Don't worry about it  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/04/2009 11:50): ok. Thanks :)

Kefran joined #xwiki at 13:17  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:18): Hi all  
alexmaru - (27/04/2009 13:18): hi glerouge  
alexmaru - (27/04/2009 13:18): ca va?  
alexmaru - (27/04/2009 13:18): hi kefran  
glerouge - (27/04/2009 13:18): très bien et toi? ;)  
alexmaru - (27/04/2009 13:18): oui, mersi :)  
asyd - (27/04/2009 13:19): tiens ca parle francais ici ? :)  
glerouge - (27/04/2009 13:19): nope  
glerouge - (27/04/2009 13:19): but alexmaru & I are having some fun  
glerouge - (27/04/2009 13:19): did you have a question by the way?  
alexmaru - (27/04/2009 13:19): nope  
alexmaru - (27/04/2009 13:20): just saying hi :)  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:20): I'm new on xWiki and i have one ;)  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:20): Hi Kefran  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:20): hi !  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:21): I would like to create a contextual navigation menu, which show links or not according an user is or not a spcific group member  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:22): but i can't find the variable to do thid  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:22): Let me check  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:23): it is an "isGroupMember" like i think but i don't find in dev docs  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:24): $xwiki.getUser($context.user).isUserInGroup('XWiki.SomeGroup')  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:24): http://maven.xwiki.org/site/xwiki-core-parent/xwiki-core/apidocs/com/xpn/xwiki/api/User.html#isUserInGroup(java.lang.String)  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:24): Ok thx i try it right now  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 13:25  
ldubost joined #xwiki at 13:31  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:32  
Kefran - (27/04/2009 13:36): It works, thanks a lot bye !  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:44): Hi everyone, the only example of how to use GraphViz w/ XWiki anywhere was http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/HowcanIusetheGraphVizPluginplugin.   Which because of the :type=dot} bit looks to be invalid XWiki 2.0 syntax  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:45): Hi jumpkick  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:45): does anyone have a 2.0 syntax GraphViz graph that they know works I can use to test if I've got the config properly  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:45): mornin' sdumitriu  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:45): or lunch for you probably  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:45): :D  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:47): We don't have a 2.0 macro for graphviz yet  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:47): But the old macro should work fine  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:49): okay, I'll renable the 1.0 syntax  
ldubost left at 13:50 ()  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:50): I was thinking I should disable it to make migration simpler as we'll be starting from scratch  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:50): I'll just make 2.0 default, instead of removing 1.0 altogether  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:50): Thanks  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:51): jumpkick: You can try to port the 1.0 macro to the new syntax  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:51): It shouldn't be hard  
ldubost joined #xwiki at 13:51  
ldubost left at 13:51 (Client Quit)  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 13:53): cristinaS: How are you?  
ldubost joined #xwiki at 13:53  
jumpkick - (27/04/2009 13:56): sdumitriu: thanks I'll give that a shot too

jvelociter joined #xwiki at 19:01  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 19:05  
ancutagheorghe joined #xwiki at 19:18  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:18): Hi everyone  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 19:19): Hi  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:19): jvelociter, around?  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:19): ancutagheorghe: yep  
KermitTheFragger left at 19:19 ("Leaving")  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:20): why aren't the classes located here XWiki/trunks/core/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/captcha used?  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:20): hi  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 19:20): They should be used  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:21): but .. ?  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 19:21): Why do you say they are not?  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:21): as there is no active captcha ...  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:22): the plugin is used in RegisterAction I believed  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:22): but indeed, nothing is exposed to the user without modification of the registration UI  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:22): ancutagheorghe: you can read this mail by glerouge http://www.mail-archive.com/[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)/msg00849.html + the entire thread  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:22): ok, i will , thanks :)  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:23): iit's a bit old but I think it still applies  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:23): the preference fields for deciding to display or not a captcha do exist already in XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:24): but they are badly named, so not very comprehensive  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 19:24): ancutagheorghe: Quick Eclipse productivity tip: right click on the name of a method and select "Open Call Hierachy"  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:24): sdumitriu, cool ! good to know  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 19:24): This will show the call tree of a method everywhere in Java  
sdumitriu - (27/04/2009 19:24): It can't trace Velocity calls, though  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:25): ancutagheorghe here is a thread that explains how the fields are named in this thread http://www.mail-archive.com/[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)/msg07162.html  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:25): it's better than nothing anyway :))  
cristinaS left at 19:25 ("Bersirc 2.2: All the original sexiness of Bersirc, open to the world. [ http://www.bersirc.org/ - Open Source IRC ]")  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:26): ok i will read these, just that i will work slow as i started final exams :P  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:28): so will the captcha continue to be optional ?  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:28): yes  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:28): ok  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:28): as it says on XE-431 description  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:28): it has to work with preferences  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:28): "displaying the fields in the administration for the user to change preferences. In section "registration" an maybe "general" for the comments, or in a new section for comments, to be discussed."  
cypromis left at 19:28 ("Leaving")  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:29): so around the call to the plugin in registerinline.vm do display the captcha image and input field, you have to test if preferences says there should be a captcha or not  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:29): using one of the xwiki#getXWikiPreference API  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:30): yes, i understand .. i think u already gave me this issue .. but i think i was in a hurry or something because i don't remember reading it  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:32): no pb  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:32): don't hesitate to bother me if you have any question  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:34): sure!  
tharindu left at 19:34 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:34): buh bye, thanks for the links :)  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:34): pa  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:35): :)))  
jvelociter - (27/04/2009 19:35): ;)  
ancutagheorghe - (27/04/2009 19:35): unexpected answer :))
